body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Natural Features & Ecosystems     Rivers and Streams                 Streams of Crater Lake National Park              Crater Lake Headwaters    Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:26 seconds  Short video excerpted from the visitors center film "Crater Lake  Into the Deep".           Streams of Crater Lake National Park NPS   Approximately 200 km of perennial streams and 115 km of intermittent streams drain outward from Mt Mazama All “wadeable streams” (peak flow < 200cfs, active channel width ≤ 10m) Most reaches contain high gradient, cold, headwater habitats Amphibians were dominant aquatic vertebrate in most streams prior to introduction of non-native fish
title: Crater Lake National Park: Rivers and Streams
